str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Away from home, sojourning in another country. From apo and demos; absent from one's own people, i.e. A foreign traveller.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give orders (injunctions, instructions, commands). From en and the base of telos; to enjoin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A door-keeper, porter. From thura and ouros; a gate- warden.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.
